text: Ajamu Baraka (born October 25, 1953) is an African American human rights activist. He was the Green Party's nominee for Vice President of the United States in the 2016 election, running with Jill Stein. Baraka has taught political science at Clark Atlanta University, Spelman College, and other academic institutions. ==References== Category:1953 births Category:Living people Category:African-American politicians Category:Educators from Chicago Category:American human rights activists Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:Politicians from Washington, D.C. Category:2016 United States vice- presidential candidates Category:Green Party of the United States politicians
title: Ajamu Baraka
